title: D's Famous Salsa Recipe
description: This salsa with canned tomatoes is easy to make in a food processor with onion, garlic, lime juice, chiles, and cilantro for a smooth or chunky dip.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Appetizers and Snacks Dips and Spreads Recipes Salsa Recipes Tomato Salsa Recipes D's Famous Salsa 4.7 (1,181) 897 Reviews 59 Photos This salsa with canned tomatoes is a Texas recipe I've developed and refined over many years. It's very fast and easy, and I usually have everything on hand. I often give it as gifts to my family back East. Submitted by Denise Smith Updated on May 15, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 59 59 59 59 Prep Time: 10 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 16 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings 2 (14.5 ounce) cans stewed tomatoes ½ onion, finely diced ¼ cup canned sliced green chiles, or to taste 3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro ½ lime, juiced 1 teaspoon minced garlic 1 teaspoon salt Directions Place tomatoes, onion, green chiles, cilantro, lime juice, garlic, and salt in a blender or food processor. Blend on low to desired consistency. I Made It Print 1,443 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 16 Calories 0g Fat 4g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 16 Calories 16 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 0% Sodium 283mg 12% Total Carbohydrate 4g 1% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 2g Protein 1g 1% Vitamin C 7mg 7% Calcium 20mg 2% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 120mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of D's Famous Salsa 01 of 59 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 59 Photo by  morgan 03/05/2021 Absolutely love this recipe! I have made it at least 5 times and can’t get enough. The only substitution I use is jalapeño peppers instead of green chiles to give it an extra kick! 03 of 59 Photo by  Pat J 02/08/2021 04 of 59 Photo by  Jessica Clements 12/03/2020 Great recipe but I did tweak it a little. I roasted fresh Roma tomatoes and 5-6 cloves of garlic. I added two jalapeños and a little chili powder, plus added zest from the lime along with the juice. It tastes great but I’ll likely add some hotter peppers next time for more spice. 05 of 59 Photo by  Jessica Clements 12/03/2020 Great recipe but I did tweak it a little. I roasted fresh Roma tomatoes and 5-6 cloves of garlic. I added two jalapeños and a little chili powder, plus added zest from the lime along with the juice. It tastes great but I’ll likely add some hotter peppers next time for more spice. 06 of 59 Photo by  Kim Powers 11/07/2019 07 of 59 Photo by  nyelhsa 10/14/2019 Great base. I used the Publix brand diced tomatoes with chilies. Minced garlic from jar, half onion, chili powder and a little fresh lemon and lime juice as recommended from other reviewers. Would definitely recommend to drain the canned tomatoes. Great recipe will definitely be making again and again. 08 of 59 Photo by  Trenton Maurer 09/17/2019 09 of 59 Photo by  Denise C. Fitzsimmons 08/30/2019 Makes the daunting task of processing all those garden tomatoes a joy. Haven’t tasted any better than this. Smells amazing! 10 of 59 Photo by  Brenda Shrable 05/19/2019 Super quick and easy!! It tastes way better than store bought. It makes quite a bit for under 5 bucks.(I did already have garlic and lime juice on hand however)! Thanks for sharing! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Fresh California Salsa 173 Ratings Fresh Tomato Salsa 759 Ratings Spicy Fresh Tomato Salsa 288 Ratings Jen's Fresh and Spicy Salsa 219 Ratings Mango Salsa 491 Ratings Black Bean Salsa 196 Ratings Spicy Salsa 28 Ratings Green Salsa 116 Ratings Simple Texas Salsa 64 Ratings Watermelon Fire and Ice Salsa 344 Ratings Tomato Salsa without Onions 17 Ratings Salsa de Tomatillo 167 Ratings Salsa 228 Ratings Fresh Salsa I 302 Ratings Fresh Salsa II 60 Ratings Smoky Four-Pepper Salsa 18 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Denise Smith
instructions: Place tomatoes, onion, green chiles, cilantro, lime juice, garlic, and salt in a blender or food processor. Blend on low to desired consistency.
